description: Farm-to-fork: agriculture, ingredients, packaged goods, grocery, foodservice, restaurants, cooking, beverages
Media industry: broadcast, streaming, print, digital publishing, social, podcasts, production, talent
General business context visuals: meetings, office work, factories, retail, transport (work context).
US regions, states, cities/markets, neighborhoods; skylines, landmarks, place context.
Natural environment: landscapes, water, weather, climate, ecosystems, seasons, environmental events.
Non-work human activities: family, leisure, sports, travel, hobbies, wellness, home life.
Illustrative / designed assets: concepts, icons, diagrams, infographics, patterns, abstract backgrounds.

extra.ai_processing: Summarize + extract entities + link to project

description: Wireframes, IA, web specs, content plans

extra.ai_processing: Extract tables + summarize + link to product/app
No AI unless approved; metadata only

description: Logical layer docs/schemas for apps (Demand Geography, etc.)
Coffee, tea, soda, beer/wine imagery if applicable, water
TV station/news, live shots, control rooms
Expanded below into Fruits/Vegetables subtypes (broad categories). Keep specific varieties in AI Tags (Raw) unless needed.
Broad fruit tag when specific type is unclear
Orange, lemon, lime, grapefruit; AI usually reliable at this level
Broad vegetable tag when specific type is unclear
Lettuce, spinach, kale (when used as salad greens)
Potato, sweet potato, carrot, beet, turnip
Non-alcoholic by default; add alcoholic only if relevant
Beer/wine/spirits; use only if you want this content searchable
Use only when context is explicit
Composition / editorial framing (use when visually obvious). Keep list moderate for consistency.
Screens, apps, dashboards, web pages, broadcast graphics captured as image
Two or more feeds shown simultaneously
Zoom/Teams-style remote guest or remote reporting
Conferences, panels, award shows, red carpet
Use only when the visual clearly signals breaking news (e.g., on-screen graphic)
Use when the machine/tech is central to the visual.
Vehicles and movement; disambiguate work vs leisure via context.
Choose the most specific level that is correct.
Extend as needed; keep stable names.
Use when relevant to intended usage.
Only when nature/environment focus, not food production
Use when the concept is explicit.
If general; Food Group if culinary focus
